pullRequest.body:
adds `SimpleGraph.odd_components_card_mono` and `SimpleGraph.odd_components_card_deleteVerts_mono` along with supporting lemma's.

In addition, migrate from `Nat.card` to `Set.ncard` where appropriate.

In preparation for Tutte's theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

[Zulip thread on Tutte's theorem](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Tutte's.20theorem)

[Example usage of this result in the proof of Tutte's](https://github.com/pimotte/TutteLean/blob/78a744a0f5e244ca56879871e7f4ab956e1ccebd/TutteLean.lean#L210)

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

maintainer delegate
Thank you for the PR!
Wow! Sorry, that fell off my radar. Feel free to ping me if you don't get a review within a week.
Do you want to use `Set.ncard` instead of `Nat.card`?

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Can you `#min_imports` this?
Done:)

```suggestion
    [DecidableRel G.Adj] (h : G â‰¤ G') :
     ({c : ConnectedComponent G' | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)}).ncard
      â‰¤ ({c : ConnectedComponent G | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)}).ncard := by
```
for readability

That's a rather odd proof layout. What about
```suggestion
  have aux (c : G'.ConnectedComponent) (hc : Odd (Nat.card c.supp)) :
      {c' : G.ConnectedComponent | c'.supp âŠ† c.supp âˆ§ Odd (Nat.card c'.supp)}.Nonempty := by
    refine Set.nonempty_of_ncard_ne_zero fun h' â†¦ ?_
    simpa [h'] using (c.odd_card_supp_iff_odd_subcomponents _ h).mp hc
```
This was kind of what I was looking for, but I didn't arrive at the refine with the inline lambda to make it clean, thanks!
Also had some trouble getting it to work with simpa, but by excluding a couple of lemma's it worked out:)

```suggestion
  refine Finite.card_le_of_injective f fun c c' fcc' â†¦ ?_
  simp only [Subtype.mk.injEq, f] at fcc'
  exact Subtype.val_injective (ConnectedComponent.eq_of_common_vertex
    ((fcc' â–¸ (aux c.1 c.2).choose_spec.1) (ConnectedComponent.nonempty_supp _).some_mem)
      ((aux c'.1 c'.2).choose_spec.1 (ConnectedComponent.nonempty_supp _).some_mem))
```

```suggestion
lemma natCard_odd_components_deleteVerts_mono [Fintype V] [DecidableEq V] (G G' : SimpleGraph V)
```
Manually adopted
Similarly here, can you avoid starting the statement on the previous line if you are gonna need a linebreak?
The terms here are quite long by themselves, I tried to emulate the style you used with the other one, but I'm not 100% it's correct.

```suggestion
theorem nonempty_supp (C : G.ConnectedComponent) : C.supp.Nonempty := C.exists_rep
```

```suggestion
lemma eq_of_common_vertex {v : V} {c c' : ConnectedComponent G} (hc : v âˆˆ c.supp)
```

```suggestion
  cases' r x y with hl hr
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
     Nat.card {c : ConnectedComponent G' | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)}
      â‰¤ Nat.card {c : ConnectedComponent G | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)} := by
```
Same below

```suggestion
    Nat.card ({c : ConnectedComponent (âŠ¤ : Subgraph G').deleteVerts u).coe |
      Odd (Nat.card c.supp)} â‰¤ Nat.card {c :
        ConnectedComponent ((âŠ¤ : Subgraph G).deleteVerts u).coe | Odd (Nat.card c.supp)} := by
```
Fixed in move to Set.ncard

```suggestion
    Odd {c : ConnectedComponent G | Odd c.supp.ncard}.ncard := by
```

```suggestion
    have : Fintype u := .ofFinite _
```
Do we really want this lemma given that it's a specialisation of `ncard_odd_components_mono`?

Fair enough. I've extracted `Subgraph.deleteVerts_mono'`, and then it's just the finite instance.

I don't really see how to extract that to a global instance without making it noncomputable, so I guess the idea is to inline that where I use it, unless you have a better suggestion:)
@b-mehta, thoughts?
Oops - didn't see this till now. This looks pretty unpleasant: I'm surprised you need something of this form... But let's go with it for now.

```suggestion
    Odd c'.supp.ncard â†”
      Odd {c : ConnectedComponent G | c.supp âŠ† c'.supp âˆ§ Odd c.supp.ncard}.ncard := by
```
looks more readable

```suggestion
  cases r x y with
  | isFalse hFalse =>
    exact Decidable.isFalse (hFalse <| Subgraph.coe_adj_sub _ _ _ Â·)
  | isTrue hTrue => 
    apply Decidable.isTrue
    refine SimpleGraph.Subgraph.Adj.coe (Subgraph.deleteVerts_adj.mpr ?_)
    exact âŸ¨trivial, x.2.2, trivial, y.2.2, hTrueâŸ©
```
just a suggestion: I find the explicit constructors to have clearer names than `left` and `right`.

I think even better would be 
```
... := fun x y =>
  if h : G.Adj x y 
    then _
    else _
```
so you don't need to name `r` at all. But this is also optional.

```suggestion
    DecidableRel ((âŠ¤ : G.Subgraph).deleteVerts u).coe.Adj := by
```
